greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Primes are replaced by their local sequence number in A000040, while composites are replaced by their sequence number in A002808; (a kind of eigen- or home-indexing).
comment: Primality or compositeness is recognizable from the terms: if successor of a term(>2) is larger by one than the term, then it labels a composite number.
link: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..1000
formula: a(n) = PrimePi(n) if n is prime; a(n) = n-PrimePi(n)-1 if n is not prime.
program: (PARI) { for (n=1, 1000, if (isprime(n), a=primepi(n), a=n - primepi(n) - 1); write("b066136.txt", n, " ", a) ) } \\ _Harry J. Smith_, Feb 02 2010
results.author: _Labos Elemer_, Dec 07 2001
